text: The Bowls England National Championships (Top Club) is one of the men's team events at the annual Bowls England National Championships. Kings BC, arguably the leading team in England have won the event four years running and the team includes Louis Ridout, Jamie Chestney and Sam Tolchard. ==Past Winners== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- !width="30"|Year !width="110"|County !width="250"|Champions !width="110"|County !width="250"|Runners-up !width="60" class="unsortable"|Score |- | align=center|2003|| Suffolk || Felixstowe & Suffolk || Wiltshire || Westlecot || 3-2 |- | align=center|2004|| Norfolk || North Walsham (EBA) || Buckinghamshire || Gerrards Cross || 3-2 |- | align=center|2005|| Buckinghamshire || Gerrards Cross || Northumberland || Gosforth || 3-2 |- | align=center|2006|| Suffolk || Felixstowe & Suffolk || Worcestershire || Worcester || 4-1 |- | align=center|2007|| Oxfordshire || Banbury Borough || Wiltshire || Westlecot || 3-2 |- |align=center|2008|| Hampshire || Aldershot Traction Athletic || Essex || Romford || 3-2 |- |align=center|2009|| Hampshire || Boscombe Cliff || Somerset || Bristol || 5-0 |- |align=center|2010|| Warwickshire || Rugby || |Devon || Shaldon || |3-2 |- |align=center|2011|| Worcestershire || Worcester || Warwickshire || Rugby || 3-2 |- |align=center|2012|| Worcestershire || Worcester || Devon || Shaldon || 3-2 |- |align=center|2013|| Nottinghamshire || Cavaliers || Cornwall || Stenalees || 3.5-1.5 |- |align=center|2014|| Cornwall || St Austell || Northamptonshire || Kingsthorpe || 3-2 |- |align=center|2015|| Northumberland ||Gosforth || Hertfordshire || Garston || 3-2 |- |align=center|2016|| Devon || Kings || Wiltshire || Royal Wootton Bassett || 4-1 |- |align=center|2017|| Devon || Kings || Berkshire || Reading ||5-0 |- |align=center|2018|| Devon || Kings || Norfolk || Norfolk BC || 3-2 |- |align=center|2019|| Devon || Kings || Buckinghamshire || Gerrards Cross || 4-1 |- |align=center|2020|| cancelled || due to the COVID-19 pandemic.|| || || |} ==References== Category:Bowls in England
